page.title: 01The Ladock Valley.
page.content: The Ladock Valley lies in the centre of Cornwall. The{Tresilian River}runs through the area and has caused the 'V' shaped valley to be formed. The sides of the valley are largely{wooded whilst the land at the tops of the valley sides is largely given over to {farming.}The area is characterised by rolling countryside bordered by the {clay works}in the East and{Ladock {Woods}in the West. Much of the land is owned by the{Duchy of Cornwall}and is leased to tenant farmers. The population is scattered amongst the farms; there being only one small hamlet called{New Mills.}The children attend schools at either{Ladock}or {Grampound Road.}Local shopping facilities are found in these villages whilst{Truro}is considered the centre for markets and trade. Secondary children attend school at{Tregony.
